name: Pinot Noir Napa Valley Carneros Truchard Vineyard
review: A ripe, spicy style, with flavors of black cherry and plum jam that are pure, supple and full-bodied, holding onto a berry-flavored finish. Drink now through 2014. 984 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County Nova Vineyard
review: Soft but zesty, with bold plum and spice aromas and lively, nicely layered flavors of spice, sage and creamy oak. Drink now through 2013. 327 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Black cherry and cassis flavors have a spicy black licorice edge. There's nice depth and roundness to the flavors, with firm, slightly chewy tannins. Drink now through 2012. 897 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County
review: Picks up steam after the matchstick aroma, with fine concentration to lime peel, grass and grapefruit character. Drink now through 2005. 490 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County ES Vineyard
review: Pleasantly grassy, with fresh herb, citrus and spicy notes. Good acidity and a slightly pithy finish. Drink now. 784 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County ES Vineyard
review: Tart, with good intensity to green and yellow apple, floral and lemon notes. Drink now. 1,200 cases made.

name: Merlot Napa Valley
review: Has modest red currant and cedar aromas, and lean cherry and spice flavors. Drink now through 2012. 446 cases made.

name: Red X California
review: Plum, spice and cherry flavors are crisp and juicy, with a rustic edge. Syrah, Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 2,800 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Los Carneros
review: Light-bodied, simple lemon flavors have a pleasant tang to them. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Lake County Nova Vineyard
review: Tart and rustic, with plum and tobacco aromas and simple cherry and herb flavors. Drink now. 448 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Lake County Eutenier Sylar Vineyard
review: Crisp, with grass, citrus and jalapeño pepper flavors. Drink now. 1,600 cases made.

name: Petite Sirah Paso Robles
review: Gritty and drying, with talcy notes to the wild berry and peppery plum flavors. 571 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley
review: Wild berry and spice notes are pleasant but muted, with a dull tannic finish that tastes like cola. 2,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Napa Valley Two Rivers Vineyard
review: Tart, with balsamic and dried pineapple flavors. 550 cases made.

name: Shiraz Mount Barker
review: Distinctly peppery, brimming with fresh-ground overtones to the plum and blackberry flavors, hinting at sage and sassafras notes on the finish. Lively acidity. Drink now through 2020. 2,200 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Barker
review: Focused and peppery, with juicy cherry and raspberry fruit, layered with coffee, mineral and spice overtones, lingering easily against refined tannins. Drink now through 2019. 2,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Mount Barker Mount Barker
review: Light and jumpy, with a silky texture to the tangerine and loquat flavors, finishing with finesse. Drink now through 2024. 800 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mount Barker
review: Ripe and plush, with velvety traction to the black cherry and plum flavors. Accents of spice and espresso add richness. Shows plenty of harmony on the finish. Drink now through 2027. 2,200 cases made.

name: Riesling Western Australia Artisan
review: Taut, tight and expressive, this lean style trails pear, honey and floral notes on the waxy finish. Drink now through 2021. 265 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Mendoza
review: Muscular, with black cherry, sweet earth and grilled sage flavors followed by a burly finish. Drink now. 1,500 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza
review: Fresh and soft, with grape and berry fruit followed by a dash of vanilla. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: This white is bright, vivid and appealing for its pure pear, peach and citrus flavors, sailing easily over the open-textured finish and showing finesse. Drink now through 2015. 600 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Margaret River
review: A smooth red, with mineral and black olive accents to the dark berry and raspberry flavors, narrowing to a focused, long beam on the expressive finish. Drink now through 2016. 600 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Ripe and spicy, with an exotic character reminiscent of chai tea most prominent, with the ripe currant and dark plum flavors lurking right behind. Needs time to sort itself out. Best from 2012 through 2018. 600 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Margaret River DJL
review: Rye toast, licorice and chai tea flavors are generous and intense, with a core of vanilla-laced cherry and plum notes. Shows plenty of harmony on the velvety finish. Drink now through 2027. 1,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River
review: Supple and open-textured, generous with its ripe black currant and blackberry flavors, finishing with a minty edge and a nudge of pleasant acidity. Drink now through 2008. 7,000 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River Exmoor
review: Offers rosemary and vanilla accents, with plush black cherry, licorice-scented plum, cedar and spice flavors lingering on the finish. The tannins are plump and velvety. Drink now through 2030. 6,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Bright and vibrant, with a toasty edge to the peppery grapefruit and pear flavors, lingering easily. Drink now through 2015. 450 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Margaret River Next Of Kin
review: This supple red is generous with its spicy red plum and currant flavors, riding easily over refined tannins and creamy oak into the long, expressive finish. Drink now through 2014. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Ripe and generous with its spicy, oak-accented tropical fruit and pear flavors, all of it echoing nicely on the balanced finish. Drink now through 2004. 9,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Next Of Kin
review: Bright and tangy, with a juicy feel to the pear and walnut flavors. A hint of root beer adds an interesting touch to the finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Margaret River
review: Round, juicy and nicely packed with flavor, layering its pear, orange peel, lime and mineral notes generously so they echo and focus through the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Shiraz Margaret River Next Of Kin
review: Smooth in texture and lively in structure, with jazzy flavors of blackberry, florwers and spice that keep zinging on the finish. Drink now through 2013. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz Margaret River-Franklin River
review: An exotic style, dense with berry fruit lavishly layered with peppery, gamy, meaty notes and green, herbal notes. Not for everyone, but it makes a statement. Drink now through 2007. 4,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Dragon
review: Fresh and tangy, with pretty pear and citrus flavors that linger on the bright finish. Drink now. 6,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon Margaret River Next Of Kin
review: Bright and jazzy, with a mint-candy character that flies over the pear flavors, persisting well. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Shiraz-Cabernet Frankland River
review: Crisp and bright, with mulberry and tangy lime notes riding on a fine-textured frame, pointing nicely into a lively finish. Drink now. 4,900 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River
review: Some nice pear and hazelnut flavors well up on the finish, but this buttery, spicy wine relies a bit much on oak. Drink now through 2006. 2,500 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River DJL
review: There's a leafy accent to the lemon, lime and green apple notes, with a touch of minerality and crunchy acidity. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon Margaret River Exmoor
review: Grassy, with lime and green apple flavors that are light and crisp. Very refreshing. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Chardonnay Margaret River Exmoor
review: Lean and focused, with lime flavors at the core. A spicy, toasty detail fans out on the finish. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Blanc Margaret River
review: Fresh and lively, with a strong herbal note running with the orange and apple flavors. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

name: Reserve Margaret River
review: Mint and red pepper aromas dominate, with just enough berry fruit to approach a balance as the finish gets firm. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. Drink now through 2005. 1,500 cases made.

name: Merlot Margaret River
review: Firm in texture, with green pepper and woody notes around a modest core of berry fruit. 500 cases made.

name: Moulin-à-Vent Vieilles Vignes
review: Polished accents of oak, graphite, ground clove and anise lace flavors of blackberry pie, sun-dried black cherry, espresso and tar in this well-knit red, with firm, integrated tannins. Chewy finish. Drink now through 2018. 2,100 cases made.

name: Moulin-à-Vent Vieilles Vignes
review: Fresh, with well-integrated acidity and focused flavors of macerated black cherry and plum, currant, cocoa powder and fruit cake. A spicy thread gains momentum on the lightly chewy finish. Drink now through 2020. 80 cases imported.

name: Moulin-à-Vent Vieilles Vignes
review: A spiced red, with chewy tannins and tightly knit flavors of sun-dried black cherry, plum cake, black licorice string and mineral. Open-knit finish. Drink now through 2021. 2,500 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Clés du Paradis
review: This is racy and nicely packed, with a core of red currant, plum and blackberry fruit framed by old-school twinges of chestnut and grilled beef. Shows lots of tobacco and hot stone on the grippy finish. Produced and bottled at R&D Vins for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2020. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 200 cases made.

name: Chablis Marly
review: Clean and stony, with a core of lemon, this builds in intensity to a long, mineral- and chalk-infused finish. Shows precise balance and a fine sense of place. Drink now through 2020. 120 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Fynbos
review: Lovely lemon curd and verbena aromas lead the way, with extra brioche, chamomile, yellow apple and heather notes filling in behind them. Offers a pretty kiss of toast on the finish. Produced and bottled by Mooiplaas Estate for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2016. 300 cases made.

name: Chablis Marly
review: Enticing notes of green plum and green tea mix with flavors of apple, lime and mineral, adding up to a complex and flavorful white. Shows fine balance and length. Drink now through 2018. 460 cases made.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: This has plump notes of lemon curd and wet straw, offset by bracing gooseberry and star fruit accents, ending with a tangy citrus spine. Textbook. Produced and bottled by La Gemière for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2019. 2,500 cases made.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: Shows lovely purity, with a good balance between the lime and jicama flavors and chive and flint notes. The finish is fresh and chiseled. Produced and bottled by La Gemière for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: Subtle but lengthy and pure, with chive flower, citrus oil and honeysuckle notes all gliding through the fleur de sel-tinged finish. Produced and bottled by Jean-Claude Chatelain for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: This taut, fresh white offers lemon zest, honeysuckle and mineral notes that race along, with mouthwatering acidity driving the finish. This is not big, but shows length and balance. Produced and bottled by Jean-Claude Chatelain for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 900 cases made.

name: uQamata Coastal Region
review: Features flavors of mulled fig, plum and black currant fruit intertwined with tobacco leaf, mulled spice, tar and warm stone notes. Offers a broad, smoky finish. Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Produced and bottled by Amani Vineyards for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2015.

name: uQamata Stellenbosch
review: Ripe and smoky, with lots of mouthfilling red and black currant fruit and layers of tobacco and roasted sage. The smoldering finish has a buried graphite edge. Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Produced and bottled by Amani Vineyards for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2012. 300 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza La Pilar Reserva
review: This features well-spiced flavors of dark plum, chocolate and cherry tart. Savory notes emerge midpalate, with balanced tannins on the well-extracted finish. Drink now through 2017. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Oscar
review: Rich with milk chocolate notes, this medium-bodied red is plush and creamy, with plenty of red fruit and spice flavors. Hints of mint show on the tensile finish. Best after 2018. 1,200 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Nationale 7
review: A rich, creamy rosé, with concentrated flavors of spice, licorice and plum. The long finish is supple and mouthfilling, with a combination of fruit and smoke notes. Cinsault, Tibouren, Grenache and Syrah. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Menetou-Salon Rouge Noir
review: This offers a good beam of dark cherry and raspberry fruit followed by savory herb and tangy iron hints. Ripe for the appellation, but stays light-bodied, with nice focus. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: Light and energetic, with thyme, lemon zest and gooseberry notes that ripple through the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases imported.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: This offers good weight, with solid herb, citrus, flint and gooseberry notes that stay nicely defined through the medium-weight finish. Produced and bottled by Jean-Claude Chatelain for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 200 cases made.

name: Sicilia Quattro Canti
review: This ripe, polished red features layered flavors of plum pudding, macerated blackberry and black fig paste wound around a dark core of graphite, bittersweet chocolate and tar notes, which fill the grippy finish. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Fynbos
review: A tightly-wound style, with lime, verbena and chartreuse notes flecking the core of creamed Jonagold apple and green plum fruit. Finish has an echo of bitter almond. Produced and bottled by Mooiplaas Wine Estate for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2013. 600 cases imported.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza Pavo Real
review: Blackberry, anise, tar and smoke notes mingle in this plush, syrupy red, which shows ripe flavors, but remains fresh, with chewy tannins and a smoky finish. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases imported.

name: Rioja Fé Reserva
review: The plum and currant flavors have a slightly dried character in this ripe red. The plush texture is supported by well-integrated tannins and gentle acidity. Coffee and orange peel accents add interest. Drink now through 2018. 400 cases made.

name: Shiraz Pemberton Waroo
review: Bright and tangy, a deftly balanced style that offers blackberry, red pepper and cherry flavors, lingering softly. Drink now through 2013. 250 cases made.

name: Chablis Marly
review: Round and fruity, like a fruit salad, with citrus notes dominating. This has good cut and a moderate finish. Produced and bottled at Domaine Hamelin for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2012. 250 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Nationale 7
review: Plump, with a juicy feel that hangs all the way through the finish while the white cherry, strawberry and watermelon rind notes play out. A stony hint keeps this honest in the end. Grenache, Cinsault, Syrah and Tibouren. Produced and bottled by Domaine de Rimauresq for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 2,500 cases imported.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Nationale 7
review: Firm and savory, with dried berry, spiced cherry and currant flavors. Tarragon and dried basil carry through to the crisp finish. Produced and bottled by Domaine de Rimauresq for Xavier Flouret. Drink now.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Nationale 7
review: A juicy and crunchy style, with hints of peach and raspberry to the ripe apple and pear flavors. Mineral and sea salt show on the firm finish. Grenache, Cinsault, Tibouren and Syrah. Drink now. 2,000 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Nationale 7
review: Fresh and crunchy, showing touches of richness to the dried herb and cherry flavors, with a good minerally snap. The finish is spicy, with hints of pear tart. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Menetou-Salon Rouge Noir
review: Soft in feel but with nice weight at the core, as supple mulled cherry and red currant notes give way to a lightly firm tobacco streak on the finish. Pinot Noir. Produced and bottled by Domaine de Chatenoy for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Premières Côtes de Blaye La Victoire
review: A fruity and delicious red, with berry and lightly meaty aromas and flavors. Medium-bodied, soft and yummy. Produced and bottled by Château Haut-Meneau for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 1,375 cases made.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: Light gooseberry and flint notes form the core, with a twinge of fleur de sel on the finish. Bracing, but a bit shy on depth in the end. Produced and bottled by Jean-Claude Chatelain for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 1,500 cases imported.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: Brisk, offering jicama, lime and flint notes, with a brisk feel to the finish. Not deep, but persistent nonetheless. Produced and bottled by Jean-Claude Chatelain for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 350 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Fynbos
review: A friendly, rounded style, with creamed yellow apple, pear and quince notes, backed by a lightly toasted finish. Produced and bottled by Mooiplaas Estate for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Chenin Blanc Stellenbosch Fynbos
review: Ripe and direct, with a beam of fig and pear notes backed by a hint of creamed melon on the open-knit finish. Produced and bottled by Mooiplaas Wine Estate for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 300 cases imported.

name: uQamata Western Cape
review: Features an old-school feel, with mint, bay leaf and singed cedar notes weaving around a core of black currant and bitter plum fruit. Cedar and pepper accents line the finish. A little grainy in feel, this is for fans of the style. Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec. Produced and bottled by Amani Vineyards for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2016. 400 cases made.

name: Ribera del Duero Crianza Pavo Real
review: Maturing now, this red offers dried cherry, tobacco, orange peel and spice flavors, with softening tannins and a spicy finish. Harmonious and still lively. Drink now through 2014. 250 cases made.

name: Malbec Mendoza La Pilar
review: A juicy red, featuring fresh raspberry and black cherry fruit that pushes through light tannins on the tarry finish. Produced and bottled at Finca La Celia for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux Quai Lumière
review: A high-toned style, with red currant and blood orange notes carried by a whiff of rooibos tea, ending with a lightly chalky spine on the finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Produced and bottled at Château Haut-Meneau for Xavier Flouret. Drink now through 2018. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 4,500 cases made.

name: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux Quai Lumière
review: This has a soft core of plum and cherry fruit, with modest tobacco and bay leaf notes along the edges. There's a dash of toast on the finish. Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Côtes de Provence Rosé Nationale 7
review: This firm and fresh-tasting rosé offers dried berry and cherry flavors that extend on the finish, with hints of herb. Drink now. 1,000 cases imported.

name: Menetou-Salon Rouge Noir
review: This has good, forward black cherry and toasted spice aromas, giving way to a clearly firm, cinnamon-dusted finish. Produced and bottled by Domaine de Chatenoy for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 300 cases made.

name: Premières Côtes de Blaye La Victoire
review: A high-toned style, offering a beam of violet backed by cherry and red currant fruit, with a light, chalky frame on the finish. Produced and bottled by Château Haut-Meneau for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 500 cases made.

name: Rioja Fé
review: Licorice, iron and leaf notes run through this inky red, accenting a core of cherry and sanguine flavors, supported by firm tannins. Distinctive, with good drive. Drink now through 2015. 400 cases imported.

name: Menetou-Salon Rouge Noir
review: Light, with modest cherry fruit spiked with slightly pungent green pepper and olive notes. Tangy, minerally finish. Drink now. 250 cases imported.

name: Malbec Mendoza La Pilar
review: Forward notes of plum, spice cake and sandalwood mingle, as slightly grippy tannins frame the finish. Produced and bottled at Finca La Celia for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 400 cases made.

name: Chablis Marly
review: Rich, with gooseberry and green plum flavors backed by moderate acidity. Produced and bottled by Domaine Hamelin. Drink now. 12,000 cases made.

name: Menetou-Salon Rouge Noir
review: Dried cherry, savory and singed cinnamon stick notes are backed by twinges of pine and cedar on the finish. A little light, dry and herbal in the end. Pinot Noir. Drink now. 0250 cases imported.

name: Menetou-Salon Rouge Noir
review: Mature, with mulled spice and tea notes taking over from the core of modest dark cherry fruit. Dusty finish. Produced and bottled at Domaine de Chatenoy for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 250 cases made.

name: Sancerre French Blonde
review: A touch lean, with white peach and citrus peel notes that are tangy, but lack some generosity on the finish. Produced and bottled by Jean-Claude Chatelain for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 500 cases imported.

name: Rioja Fé Reserva
review: Plum pudding, licorice and vanilla flavors mingle in this plump, generous red. Firm tannins add backbone, then give way to a spicy finish. Drink now through 2011. 250 cases imported.

name: Torrontés Cafayate Valley Flaca
review: This spicy, round white offers candied citrus zest and cooked melon notes that lie flat on the finish. Produced and bottled by Uvas del Valle for Xavier Flouret. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Sauvignon Touraine
review: Shows good zip, with chive, flint and lime notes leading to a fresh-edged finish. Drink now. 3,800 cases made.

name: Sauvignon Touraine
review: Bony, with dry, taut lime, fennel seed and chive notes and a brisk finish. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

name: Côte-Rôtie
review: This has lots of fresh, pure raspberry, damson plum and cherry coulis notes streaming along together, flanked by violet and iron flavors that lend cut through the driven finish. Light bay and anise hints flicker in the background. Best from 2017 through 2028. 100 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Côte Châtillon
review: Rich and creamy, with apricot, quince and glazed peach flavors gliding through. A light ginger thread gives the finish energy, but this is languid in feel overall. Drink now. 40 cases imported.

name: Condrieu Marmouzin
review: Offers a lush, flattering feel, with almond and ginger cream notes coating the core of apricot and glazed peach fruit flavors. Warm brioche details hang on the finish. For the hedonist crowd. Drink now. 81 cases imported.

name: Viognier Collines Rhodaniennes
review: An exotic panoply of nectarine, peach and anise notes marks this varietal version, backed by racy mirabelle plum and quinine notes that impart tension through the finish. Drink now through 2018. 81 cases imported.

name: Meursault Les Charmes
review: Supple and focused, this Meursault evokes apple, peach, butterscotch and spice flavors. The tannins on the finish impart a tactile and slightly coarse impression, but this should come together nicely. Best from 2016 through 2024. 45 cases imported.

name: Beaune Les Cent-Vignes
review: Rich black cherry and plum flavors up front, with a fleshy texture, lead to dense, dusty tannins on the back end.  Solid and muscular, needing time to integrate. Best from 2016 through 2030. 20 cases imported.

name: Beaune Les Toussaints
review: This rich red boasts black cherry, violet and light spice flavors. Fresh and vivid, with refined tannins for support and fine length. Best from 2014 through 2025. 20 cases imported.

name: Meursault Le Limozin
review: An expressive style, boasting apple, vanilla, grapefruit, toast and smoke flavors. Has the stuffing to match the oak, which recedes a little on the long finish. Exhibits balance and length, but some may find this too oaky. Drink now through 2020. 40 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: Focused like a laser, this lime-, apple- and mineral-infused white stays persistent from beginning to end, with the requisite flesh to cover its bones. Fine length. Needs a few years to show its best. Best from 2012 through 2024.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: A pungent nose of hot stone, wax and citronella turns more to lime and butter in the mouth. Well-structured and lively, staying focused and graceful through the lingering aftertaste. Drink now through 2014. 37 cases imported.

name: Beaune Les Cent-Vignes
review: Silky in texture and boasting ripe cherry and raspberry fruit, this red is juicy and long. Spice, mineral and smoke notes add dimension on the lingering aftertaste. Best from 2018 through 2029. 25 cases imported.

name: Beaune Les Toussaints
review: Pure cherry notes define this elegant yet firmly structured red. Mineral and spice accents add depth, and the finish is lean and long. Should be better in a year or two. Best from 2017 through 2028. 50 cases imported.

name: Beaune Les Toussaints
review: Shows purity to the cherry, raspberry and mineral aromas and flavors, enhanced by vibrant acidity. The tannins are refined and integrated, lending an elegant, harmonious feel. Fine length. Best from 2015 through 2023. 20 cases imported.

name: Meursault Le Limozin
review: Toasted brioche and baking spice aromas yield to flavors of baked apple, melon, grapefruit and spice. A firm edge of acidity shows on the finish. Fine length. Drink now through 2020. 40 cases imported.

name: Meursault Les Charmes
review: Vanilla, clove and nutmeg flavors are joined by peach and melon notes in this steely white. Ends with a light grapefruit peel bitterness, remaining persistent. Best from 2017 through 2024. 45 cases imported.

name: Meursault Les Charmes
review: Flavors of lime, spring blossoms, citronella and mineral hold court in this intense white, which is well-structured and persistent, with a lingering aftertaste of flowers and spice. Drink now through 2019.

name: Meursault Les Charmes
review: Racy, with hints of spice, lemon, apple and, above all, mineral aromas and flavors. This seems slightly dilute on one hand, yet the stony intensity prevails through the finish. Best from 2011 through 2021.

name: Meursault Les Charmes
review: A sleek style for the vintage, featuring butter candy, citrus and mineral notes. The vibrant acidity keeps this fresh and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2012. 48 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: Plenty of baking spice notes adorn the peach and melon fruit in this juicy version. Balanced, with a tangy finish that evokes grapefruit peel. Best from 2016 through 2022. 45 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: Though broad and rich, this is underscored by lively acidity, with a backdrop of peach, apple tart and baking spice flavors that reveal a touch of lemon. The finish evokes a toasty brioche element. Best from 2015 through 2022. 40 cases imported.

name: Volnay Clos des Chênes
review: Aromatic and spicy, offering incense, olive, rose and cherry notes, matched to a silky texture. Features a long finish, driven by vivid acidity and fine balance. Best from 2018 through 2030. 25 cases imported.

name: Volnay Clos des Chênes
review: Cherry, raspberry, floral and mineral flavors combine with the vibrant structure in this muscular, lively red. Focused, leaving a chalky sensation on the finish. Best from 2015 through 2021. 20 cases imported.

name: Volnay Clos des Chênes
review: Clean and extracted, this features cherry and spice flavors, finishing on the tight side. Intense and pure, but will need time to unwind. Displays plenty of fruit and structure, with a lingering finish. Best from 2015 through 2026. 40 cases imported.

name: Volnay Clos des Chênes
review: Dark and meaty, exhibiting black currant and black cherry flavors matched to a dense texture. The tannins are firm yet ripe, and the acidity keeps it all bright and fresh. Nice length. Best from 2011 through 2020.

name: Beaune Les Cent-Vignes
review: Cherry, floral and spice flavors are married to a supple texture, all backed by a solid structure. Shows moderate length on the finish. 40 cases imported.

name: Meursault Le Limozin
review: A solid white, boasting peach, apple and butter flavors accented by oak spice. Nicely integrated, with a lingering butterscotch and nutmeg finish. Drink now through 2015. 40 cases imported.

name: Meursault Le Limozin
review: The floral, apple and quince flavors stray into Riesling territory, but the oak spice confirms Chardonnay. This is elegant and has equilibrium, with a hint of grapefruit on the firm finish. Drink now through 2014. 62 cases imported.

name: Meursault Les Charmes
review: An open, fluid style, encompassing lime blossom, apple, honey and hazelnut notes. Well put together, with a fresh, mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2016. 45 cases imported.

name: Monthélie
review: Rich, with sweet smoke, cherry, strawberry and earth flavors melding with the medium-weight structure. Turns more linear on the finish, presenting a long, smoky finish. Best from 2015 through 2023. 20 cases imported.

name: Pommard Les Vignots
review: This is compact and dense, with cherry and currant flavors accented by earth and iron. A firm grip holds down the finish. Give this a few years in the cellar and think braised beef or stew. Best from 2018 through 2026. 70 cases imported.

name: Pommard Les Vignots
review: A vibrant, blackberry-laced red, showing hints of wild cherry and cola, with firm tannins on the long finish. Fruity and pure, yet with no real sense of place. Best from 2013 through 2020. 35 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet
review: Rich and nutty, with almond and hazelnut notes mingling with honey and oak spice flavors. There's a hint of floral and orange as it glides to a lingering finish. Drink now through 2017. 30 cases imported.

name: Puligny-Montrachet Les Folatières
review: Rich, yet lively too, sporting peach, lime and mineral flavors. It's harmonious and shows fine persistence on the finish. Best from 2013 through 2022. 45 cases imported.

name: Volnay Clos des Chênes
review: Offers ripe black cherry, herb and mineral flavors up front, while the tannins close down the finish for now. A mineral note lingers. Best from 2017 through 2028. 40 cases imported.

name: Bourgogne White
review: A rich, broad white, showing floral, talcum powder and lemon curd flavors. Bright acidity keeps it lively and mouthwatering. Drink now through 2013. 350 cases imported.

name: Maranges Clos de la Fussière
review: A touch oaky now, with black cherry and plum flavors underneath. On the earthy side, showing density and grip on the moderate finish. Best from 2016 through 2020. 30 cases imported.

name: Maranges Clos de la Fussière
review: A rich, fleshy style, with lively acidity punctuating the cherry and currant flavors. Picks up a hint of earth and spice during the lingering finish. Drink now through 2015. 30 cases imported.

name: Meursault Le Limozin
review: Aromas of butter and toast lead to lime and grapefruit in this ripe, vibrant white. It's crisp on the finish, yet lingers. Could use a few more months to knit. Best from 2010 through 2018.

name: Monthélie White Les Duresses
review: A lean, lemony version, remaining linear and channeling a mineral accent on the long finish. Drink now through 2017. 30 cases imported.

name: Monthélie White Les Duresses
review: A crisp white, mixing lemon, apple and stone flavors. This is straightforward, with nice richness in the middle, before firming up on the finish. Best from 2010 through 2014.

name: Pommard Les Vignots
review: A tightly coiled red, with cherry, strawberry and spice flavors bound up with a dense, tannic structure. The finish is austere despite a beam of pure cherry and mineral elements. Best from 2018 through 2028. 25 cases imported.

name: Pommard Les Vignots
review: Vibrant, offering currant, rhubarb and sweet spice flavors from the light oak treatment. Crisp and firm, with a mouthwatering finish. Drink now through 2019. 35 cases imported.

name: Bourgogne White
review: Round and supple, with a touch of oak adding dimension to the peach and lemon flavors. It's bright and balanced, leaving a spicy element on the finish. Drink now through 2011.

name: Meursault Les Chevalières
review: Citrus oil and citronella aromas and flavors predominate, with hints of apple and clove. On the rustic side, and moderately long. Drink now through 2015. 73 cases imported.

name: Monthélie
review: This is fruity, evoking cherry, strawberry and spice flavors. Tightens up on the finish, though the fruit notes linger. Best from 2017 through 2022. 25 cases imported.

name: Monthélie
review: A beam of cherry runs through this red, whose light tannins and acidity lend support. Earth and vegetal accents add depth on the firm finish. Drink now through 2016. 20 cases imported.

name: Monthélie White Les Duresses
review: Round, offering smoke, peach, apple and spice aromas and flavors. Light tannins offer grip as this ends with moderate length. Drink now. 30 cases imported.

name: Pommard Les Vignots
review: Expressing blackberry and black currant flavors, this young, medium-weight red offers moderate depth and length. Enjoy this for its fruit. Drink now through 2012.

name: Maranges Clos de la Fussière
review: This has a hard edge of tannins, but also bright cherry and strawberry fruit notes. Earthy, woodsy and minerally accents join in. Moderate length. Drink now through 2018. 50 cases imported.

name: Volnay Les Chênes
review: Broad and ripe, offering plum, cherry and mineral flavors. Yet this lacks zip, turning dry on the finish. Best from 2010 through 2016. 52 cases imported.

name: Bourgogne White Les Grandes Coutures
review: This broad white offers quince and green tea notes, ending with a grapefruit peel accent. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Monthélie
review: Starts out fairly lush and textured, with cherry and earth notes, then firms up in the finish. Should be ready soon. Drink now through 2013. 30 cases imported.

name: Bourgogne White Les Grandes Coutures
review: An elegant, focused version, exhibiting grapefruit, apple and spice flavors. Just slightly pinched on the finish. Drink now. 400 cases imported.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: A fat, plush white, offering apple, melon and clove flavors. A touch hot. Drink now. 25 cases imported.

name: Chassagne-Montrachet
review: On the acidic side and straightforward, finishing with bitterness.

name: Pommard Les Vignots
review: Wild underbrush and herb notes accent cherry and licorice flavors. Medium-bodied, with a chewy texture and slightly gritty tannins. Drink now through 2012. 52 cases imported.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Cuvée Anonyme
review: Gutsy and fleshy in feel, with enticing notes of cherry preserves, plum compote and raspberry pâte de fruit, laced with licorice root and roasted apple wood details. A good graphite edge carries the finish. Best from 2020 through 2028. 2,500 cases made.

name: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Les Bédines
review: A dark, gutsy style, with a tarry frame and a robust core of pastis, blackberry cobbler and melted licorice snap. Singed wood and charcoal notes line the finish. Lacks the range of the top examples, but remains rock solid. Drink now through 2020. 2,000 cases made.

name: Brut Champagne
review: Elegant, with a supple mousse and vibrant structure supporting flavors of brioche, vanilla and candied citrus. Fine lingering finish with a mouthwatering appeal. Drink now. 700 cases imported.

name: Côtes du Rhône
review: Solid, with a gutsy edge to the mix of dark plum and blackberry fruit, entwined with licorice root and singed juniper notes. Drink now through 2018. 4,500 cases made.

name: Côtes du Rhône Vieilles Vignes LePrince
review: Gentle in feel, with supple plum and cherry fruit lined with hints of lavender and rosemary, lingering on the finish. Drink now. 3,000 cases made.

name: Rioja
review: There's bright berry fruit in this red, but it's quite spritzy and shows a bitter edge. 480 cases made.

name: Conca de Barberá Blanc de Blancs
review: Soft and simple, a plain white with some hints of earthiness to liven it up.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Oregon Echo West Vineyard
review: Focused, velvety and appealing, offering ripe black fruit at the core, with herbal and savory shadings. Shows intensity and depth. Drink now through 2016. 56 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: A seductive style, showing youthful vitality, serving up a hint of creamy, mocha-laced oak around a ripe core of dark berry, loamy earth, herb, cedar and cigar box notes. Glides along on the finish, with ripe, juicy tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec.2004 California Cabernet blind retrospective (August 2014). Drink now through 2022. 1,050 cases made.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Lewelling Vineyards
review: A dense, assertive style, with layers of rich flavors and a taut body and structure. A successful style, where the mix of mocha-scented dark berry, currant and anise flavors is framed by cedary oak. The fruit pushes through with ease. Drink now through 2028. 188 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Aging nicely, with pure, youthful plum, cassis, dark berry, floral and black licorice notes. This firms nicely too, as the tannins give it backbone, yet the flavors push through. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec.—2002 California Cabernet blind retrospective (May 2012). Best from 2013 through . 972 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: A showy style for the vintage, pure, rich, ripe and juicy, with lovely plum, blackberry, black licorice and subtle earthy touches. Firms on the finish. Should age beautifully. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Best from 2013 through 2026. 344 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Notably supple, rich and graceful, offering smooth currant, plum and anise flavors, with a touch of mint, black tea and cherry folding in. At an ideal drinking stage. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec.2003 California Cabernet blind retrospective (July 2013). Drink now through 2019. 1,462 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Notably smooth and creamy, with a broad range of lively mocha, espresso, currant, dried berry, tobacco and cedar. Full-bodied, intense and persistent on the finish, where the tannins flex their strength. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec.—2001 California Cabernet blind retrospective (June 2011). Drink now through 2016. 392 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Notably rich and chocolaty, with fresh roasted coffee, dark berry, licorice, cedar and dried herb notes. Deftly balanced, rich in tannin and prominent cedary, charry oak flavors. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2024. 250 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Mature and a tad dry, this features a grainy texture, dried dark berry notes, firm, mineral-laced tannins and touches of black licorice. Gains velocity on the finish. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2022. 388 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Aromas of smoke, herb, dried berry and anise are intense, full-bodied, firm and concentrated, just starting to unfold now and sure to get better. Showing plenty of toasty, dill-laced oak now. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Drink now through 2016. 975 cases made.

name: Napa Valley
review: Offers complex ripe plum and blackberry fruit, with mineral, herb, sage and steeped tea-like tannins that give this a dry, savory texture. Needs aeration. Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Malbec. Best from 2012 through 2018. 928 cases made.

name: Malbec Zonda Valley
review: Round, soft and fresh, with plum and milk chocolate notes followed by an easygoing finish. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Zonda Valley
review: On the firm side, with dusty tannins carrying black cherry and toast notes. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Syrah Zonda Valley
review: Forward style, with medium-weight plum fruit covered over with a layer of vanilla. Drink now. 2,500 cases made.

name: Malbec Zonda Valley
review: Dark and rich, with raspberry and blackberry fruit, but a persistently firm, smoky edge holds it back. A bit tart in the end too. Drink now. 1,100 cases imported.

name: Cabernet Sauvignon Lake County Sonatina Vineyard
review: Earthy, mulch-flavored and bitter. Tasted twice, with consistent notes. 485 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Old Vine
review: Zesty and balanced, offering raspberry and anise aromas, with focused cherry and spice flavors that finish on a crisp note. Drink now through 2017. 5,360 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley 50 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Jammy yet nicely structured, with ripe raspberry and licorice aromas and supple huckleberry, white pepper and toasty sage flavors that linger toward briary tannins. Drink now through 2014. 1,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Old Vine
review: Zesty and user-friendly, with spicy cherry and dried sage notes. Drink now through 2020. 16,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley 100 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Appealing smoky cherry aromas lead to tart, briary boysenberry and toasty sage flavors. Drink now through 2016. 523 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Russian River Valley 50 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Zesty, offering tart plum and white pepper aromas and crisp, lively blueberry muffin, licorice and mineral flavors. Drink now through 2013. 1,200 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley 100 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Tightly focused, with black cherry, pepper, coffee and peat moss notes and a firm, acidic backbone framed by muscular tannins. Drink now through 2013. 448 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Alexander Valley 50 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: A spicy cherry pie of a Zinfandel, with zesty flavors and aromas that show notes of pepper, bay leaf and smoky oak. The finish is a bit steely with tannins. Drink now. 574 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California 10 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Soft and easygoing, with cherry, herb and spice notes. Drink now. 4,960 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley 100 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Modest in scale but appealing for its tart plum, licorice and spice notes. Drink now. 485 cases made.

name: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Reserve
review: Aromas of huckleberry lead to briary but modest flavors of raspberry and spicy herb. Drink now through 2017. 275 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California 10 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Soft and juicy, with modest notes of chocolate-covered cherry and spice. Drink now. 23,000 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California 10 Year Old Vines Vine Age Series
review: Juicy and fun if generic, showing modest notes of cherry and vanilla. Drink now. 7,952 cases made.

name: Zinfandel California Old Vine
review: Simple and soft, with slight raspberry and grilled herb flavors. Drink now through 2016. 12,142 cases made.
